== José Ernesto Dávila Pantoja ==

I'm José Ernesto Dávila Pantoja. I was born in Corinto, Nicaragua (UTC-6) on July 26th 1981. I'm graduated on Computer Science at '''<nowiki>[[http://www.unanleon.edu.ni|Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua - León (UNAN - León)]]</nowiki>'''.

I'm Ubuntu user since Warty and I'm <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.org.ni/nicaragua/miembros|official member]]</nowiki>, co-founder and member of the <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.org.ni/nicaragua/cc|Community Council]]</nowiki> of the '''<nowiki>[[NicaraguanTeam|Ubuntu Nicaraguan LoCo Team]]</nowiki>'''. And '''Ubuntu Member''' since January 20th 2010.

== My Contribution to Ubuntu ==

As official member of the Nicaraguan LoCo Team I'm part of the #ubuntu-ni IRC Channel operators and help with the administration of the mailing list always keeping and encouraging others to keep the Code of Conduct in both places.

=== Presentations ===

* ''Introduction to Free Software and GNU/Linux'', at the very first event organized by the Nicaraguan LoCo Team. <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/NicaraguanTeam/Eventos/Marzo2007#Fotos del Evento|Pictures]]</nowiki>
* ''Webmapping with <nowiki>[[UbuntuGIS]]</nowiki>'' during the FLISOL 2007.
* ''Christian applications for Ubuntu'' LinuxTour Ubuntero at Young Life chapter León.<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/NicaraguanTeam/Eventos/Abril2008#Fotos|Pictures]]</nowiki>
* ''Ubuntu 9.10 Goods - Gnome Shell'' during the Karmic Release Party. <nowiki>[[http://picasaweb.google.com/nacross/Krp|Pictures]]</nowiki>
* ''The Ubuntu Nicaraguan LoCo Team'' at American College. <nowiki>[[http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_d5fhywzpNuM/S8enkdOyCgI/AAAAAAAADUU/7Mrm65pSQS8/s1600/dsc02998.jpg|Picture]]</nowiki>

== My Future as Ubuntu Member ==

=== Inside the Community ===

* Work with the Ubuntu Spanish Translation Team to get _all_ the Ubuntu Package Description translated into Spanish
* Become MOTU :-)
* Support Members of the NicaraguanTeam to get approved as Ubuntu Members ;-)
* Make Ubuntu the official distro at my workplace (the Council for Foreign Affairs)
* Work with other centralamerican communities in common projects

=== Outside the Community ===

* Support elementary schools in my hometown with their OLPC's :-)
* Participate as lecturer in workshops to spread Ubuntu to all kind of audience but specially the non-geeks.
